articles.title: EXPLAINER: What you need to know about 'Early Warnings for All' initiative
articles.author: CAMILLA AKETCH
articles.summary: The Kenyan government officially launched the Early Warnings for All initiative on May 21, 2025. It is a global initiative launched in 2022 by UN Secretary-General António Guterres. It aims to ensure that by the end of 2027, every person on the planet is protected by life-saving early warning systems. A national workshop is being held in Nairobi from May 21-23, 2025 to develop an implementation roadmap for expanding the coverage and effectiveness of the initiative. Kenya has faced increasing climate-related disasters in recent decades. President William Ruto was named World Meteorological Organisation Champion for the EW4All Initiative in Africa during the 2023 Africa Climate Summit.
